definition: call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
surname Shao/name of an ancient state that existed in what is now Shaanxi Province
to call together/to summon/to convene/temple or monastery (used in place names in Inner Mongolia)
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: The next morning they were summoned to see the commanding general.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上，将军召见他们。

sentences.english: The Norwegian Foreign Ministry summoned Iran's envoy (charge d'affaires) in Oslo to protest the action.
sentences.chinese: 挪威外交部召见伊朗驻奥斯陆外交官提出抗议。

sentences.english: The widow will see you next, noble ser.
sentences.chinese: 一下子寡妇会召见您的，尊贵的爵士。

sentences.english: After your correspondent's departure, local officials called on Zhu Longwei.
sentences.chinese: 在记者离开后，当地官员召见了朱龙伟。

sentences.english: Then the king called letter to him.
sentences.chinese: 于是汉王召见韩信拜他为大将。

sentences.english: Two weeks later, the shah met with Etemad again.
sentences.chinese: 两个星期之后，国王又召见了艾特马。

sentences.english: When Panggong came back from Handan, the Emperor Wei never interviewed him.
sentences.chinese: 当庞恭从邯郸回魏国时，魏王再也不愿意召见他了。

sentences.english: The emperor called his ministers into the throne room.
sentences.chinese: 皇帝在金銮殿召见大臣们。
一见李渊来了，杨广立即召见。

definition: to have an audience with
to receive sb/to grant an interview
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
special envoy/special ambassador
to discuss official business
to summon for an interview
to have an audience (with the emperor)
to enter the emperor's palace/(slang) to go to jail
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
to report (to one's superior)
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
to put forward a suggestion (to sb in a senior position)/to offer a word of advice
pay an official call/call on/visit in an official capacity
to return to the capital
issue a decree
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
